programme.title: Lawnmower Man 2: Beyond Cyberspace
programme.desc: An evil corporation planning an inescapable global computer network hires a mentally impaired laborer (Matt Frewer) made into a genius by virtual reality.

programme.title: The Super
programme.desc: Ordered to live among his tenants in squalor, a New York slumlord (Joe Pesci) does so and sees the light.

programme.title: The Last Seduction
programme.desc: An insurance executive (Linda Fiorentino) skips town with drug money and stops at nothing to get what she wants.

programme.title: Dr. Giggles
programme.desc: An asylum escapee (Larry Drake) plays doctor on a killing spree, then decides to do a heart transplant.

programme.title: Clockwatchers
programme.desc: Friendship helps make nightmarish office jobs bearable for four young women working as temporary employees.

programme.title: Living in Oblivion
programme.desc: A harried director must contend with technical foul-ups and actors' shenanigans on the set of a low-budget film.

programme.title: Welcome Home, Roxy Carmichael
programme.desc: An offbeat Ohio teenager (Winona Ryder) eagerly awaits the return of a legendary wild one she figures is her mother.

programme.title: FernGully ... the Last Rainforest
programme.desc: A lumberjack helps a tribe of rain-forest elves protect their kingdom from an evil spirit and greedy clear-cutters.

programme.title: The Road to Wellville
programme.desc: Dr. John Kellogg (Anthony Hopkins) treats a young couple (Bridget Fonda, Matthew Broderick) for their imagined ailments at his Michigan sanitorium circa 1907.

programme.title: Point Break
programme.desc: An FBI agent (Keanu Reeves) turns California surfer to nab bank robbers who wear rubber masks of four ex-presidents.

programme.title: Crime Story
programme.desc: A Hong Kong detective (Jackie Chan) teams with a police veteran (Kent Cheng) to rescue a wealthy businessman from kidnappers.

programme.title: Breakfast of Champions
programme.desc: An unhappy car dealer (Bruce Willis) believes that a dime-store author/philosopher (Albert Finney) has the answers to life's important questions.
